website_summaries.verdict: The Vivosport is a good fitness companion for people who want an activity tracker with plenty of advanced features.
pros: The Vivosport packs smartwatch features into an activity-band design that's lightweight, comfortable to wear, and has good battery life
It's fully waterproof and has built-in GPS and 24-7 heart-rate monitoring
cons: Some of the features are a little difficult to access
GPS can take too long to lock in

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid Garmin user for over 10 years. I purchased this to supplement some of the other devices that I have and wanted a daily activity tracker. I have been sent 2 replacements since I purchased this back in March and it hardly ever works and that is about the only thing I can count on. Step count off, stair count off, and the GPS has NEVER worked or it takes 20 minutes to pair up with a satelite and I live in the city. I can honestly say this has been the biggest waste of money I have ever spent on any sporting equipment, save yourself a headache and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: coleycole99

customer_reviews.title: First one, only held a charge for 3 days ...
customer_reviews.text: First one, only held a charge for 3 days. Suppose to be 8. Second held a charge for 5 days. I can live with that. But not what manufacture says it will do. And now it isn't accurate on stairs or steps after 1 month. Just got a software update, so we will see if they fixes it. Otherwise this one is going back as well. Make sure you get the extended warranty. You will need it.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Hightshoe

customer_reviews.title: Strap is terrible. HRM is inconsistent. Everything else is fine.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy interface Automatic tracking for walking/running activities App is versatile and useful Nice for finding your phone Cons Strap breaks easily, rendering watch useless Strap is not replaceable Strap broke right after warranty expired HRM isn't very accurate Strap needs to be uncomfortably tight to get reasonable HR ratings, but still inconsistent. Motion sensing for illuminating the face stopped working after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Solomon Grundy

customer_reviews.title: I love that I can get it wet and not worry
customer_reviews.text: Works well with pixel 2. Was surprised it knows when I'm on the elliptical or running. It lasts for days and charges quickly. I love that I can get it wet and not worry. I have not had much luck with watches lasting in the past but this seems solid so far. Only complaint is twice now the Bluetooth partially stopped working and would not show phone notifications. I have to unpair and then repair my phone to get it to work again. The pairing process seems picky if you don't do steps in just the right time. Hopefully this will go away with a software update and then I'll give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan MacRae

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness tracker/watch for those with small wrists
customer_reviews.text: You can read the detailed reviews by folks like DC Rainmaker etc. This is a great value for the money. It is perfect for someone who wants all of the main fitness features, plus GPS and phone notifications. It is still not small enough for folks with tiny wrists. The most important thing to me is not missing important phone calls or texts because my phone is on silent. This solves that problem, it vibrates and I can check to see who it is or read the text. Great when you have kids that need to be able to reach parents. Or to remind you of appointments in quiet environments.
customer_reviews.author: Value Conscious

customer_reviews.title: Watch worked great for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Watch worked great for 3 months. After that it stopped counting steps and the screen was so slow, I couldn't start or stop a workout, swipe through displays, etc. The lady on the phone from Garmin said it was a battery issue and sent me a charger. Did not help at all. While it was working, the only issue I had was having to wear it very tight to track my heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but band broke after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, good fit and decent accuracy...But my brand broke 4 months after purchase as I was taking it off one evening (no warning signs of wear and tear). I'm not a 'super-active' user so this was very disappointing. I sent the whole device back for replacement which could take 2+ weeks. Buyers beware this could be a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I wanted. Something small that fits my wrist and does the tracking and has gps as well. It works great, it's compact and water resistant. The battery life is not too bad, with gps on I have to charge frequently but if not on gps then it will last a week. I use it for tracking steps but mainly use it for jogging. you can also use this for other exercises and measures stress level and VO2. I have had it for a while and I haven't had any issues with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cerine

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.  Recommended for any one like looking for good, and above avg tracker.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. Gos works great, light weight and I don't even know it is there most times. When I first stRt wearing it I got a small rash, but it has gone away and my wrist is use to it. I wear it 24/7 except for charging. I use gps frequently and it needs charged every 4 days or so. It is waterproof, but doesn't come with swim capabilities. This is why I didn't not give 5 stars. It can track while in the water but the water messes with the tocuh screen and it ends up losing the activity if in water. Other then that it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Williams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great device so far! Charged fast and set up easy as long as Bluetooth was connected! It has sleep tracking and stress levels which I loved! The app is easy to use and helpful. The information marched perfect with gym machinery. The band feels great on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Viviosport
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2 story house and I was up and down more than 5 times this morning and it didn't track them anything on the stairs. I haven't been able to figure out how to activate the sleep cycle yet. There was nothing in the booklet. The booklet that came with it was minimal. I guess I'll have to check online.
customer_reviews.author: CarolAnne Mocarski

customer_reviews.title: Soft band equals low durability
customer_reviews.text: This is our third and final Garmin fitness tracker, I think. We picked it for the GPS (which was spotty at best) and the water resistance (which worked very well). The problem is that in less than 2 months and the band broke on my husband's watch, and less than 6 months and mine is completely Kaput. If the watch freezes up, you really have to wait until the battery dies because of the touch screen only. In the pool, even locked, the water plays havoc with the screen. You have to tap it twice in a row to unlock, but the water had no trouble doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but wish they used standard USB cable
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for 6 months and it is working fine. It helps to watch some YouTube videos to learn about all the features. They have jammed a lot into a small user interface. I also have a larger format Garmin that is a bit easier for me to use due to the larger interface and additional buttons but the small form factor is nice if you are concerned about the bulk of a traditional GPS watch. I would give it a 5th star if it used a standard USB charging interface. I hate proprietary cables.
customer_reviews.author: David Lapierre

customer_reviews.title: The battery life will get worse after only 3 months of using it
customer_reviews.text: Ok I'm done with this band. The battery life will get worse after only 3 months of using it !! It was 4-5 days with the I tried all the solutions suggested on the reviews here or on other websites. I disabled the activity tracking. reduced the light. and still it last maximum 2 days. I'm using since almost 5 months. It is expensive, but did I really buy the brand only?
customer_reviews.author: Yasser Sinjab

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate long term
customer_reviews.text: The stair counter was accurate for about 10 months, but the last 7 months it has been incredibly inaccurate. Some days the watch says I have climbed over 4 times as many stairs as I really have (40 flights/day, when the goal/reality is 10 flights/day). I am guessing the barometer is broken but there is nothing I can do to fix it. I suspect the pedometer is not the best too. Some days the number of steps it says I've taken seems like an overestimate. I do think the app is easy to use, as well as the GPS/maps have been accurate. Additionally the sleep tracker works pretty well most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable "normal" tracking. Horrendous sport tracking.
customer_reviews.text: It's reasonably comfortable and the screen is super responsive. The menu system takes some getting used to as there are some inconsistencies in the navigation, but considering there are no buttons and only 2 swipe directions what are ya gonna do? The 24/7 HR tracking seemed accurate, but couldn't track a CrossFit workout AT ALL. If you want accurate sport based HR go with a chest HR strap or more expensive optical HR readers.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Good watch - SLOW GPS
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older vivo hr+ with the vivosport and overall, it's a good watch. The steps and mileage are accurate. My only slight complaint is how long it takes the GPS to pick up a signal - some days, I've waited upwards of 5-10 minutes to head out on a run before the GPS picked up the signal. A couple times, the GPS signal would not even lock and I ran without the GPS in "inside" mode. Otherwise, this is a great activity tracker and I like the features overall.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Vivosport watch - Wrist band that is defective, twice!
customer_reviews.text: I started wearing my Garmin Vivosport on 04/19/2018, ***I like everything about it except that the metal part of the wrist band broke within 6 days of wearing it. I think Garmin needs to improve the quality of the band. Everything else, I love, especially the app! I am going to return it for now. This is the second Garmin Vivosport watch I buy. Both times it is the wrist band that is defective. This time, the wrist band became apart from the watch, very poor quality. The actual watch has not given me issues.
customer_reviews.author: MariaRV

customer_reviews.title: Longevity is an issue
customer_reviews.text: I like the features of this product. I previously owned a vivofit and it worked well for 2 years. When I called Garmin I was told to blow air into the hole in the back to reset the altimeter function. It did not work. I upgraded to the Vivosport HR but the stair counting feature stopped working after less than 2 months. In less than 6 months the battery is running down very quickly and requires charging daily.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Heartrate Monitor is extremely inaccurate, bluetooth connection laughable
customer_reviews.text: Heartrate monitor does not even come close to being accurate. Off by 30-60% on average compared to my fitbit. It was saying I had a 75 BPM during exteme cardio (cycling) then 45 minutes later when showering, showed that I had a 120 BPM. Device also gets very upset if you get more than 2 feet away from your connected phone. Many times I would be sitting down with my phone in my pocket and the bluetooth would disconnect and reconnect repeatedly, which causes it to vibrate each time to notify me that it disconnected/reconnected. I wouldn't waste my money on this again. There are far to many other options out there.
customer_reviews.author: D-No

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So far so awesome. By far the best tracker I have owned. It's small and light but very powerful. The re designed app is also much easier to use. It's not as "fashionable" as some others, but I'm not a tool. I want a fitness tracker that works, and this does.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bittick

customer_reviews.title: No frills, reliable GPS beauty
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use (running and cycling). Finally a proper, durable, waterproof, GPS tracker with no frills (I hate smartwatches - I already have a watch and don't need apps, notifications etc). Battery lasts a week. It's reliable, and easy to use. Have recommended to all my friends. Only thing it misses is a swim mode (however you just put it on stopwatch and count your lengths).
customer_reviews.author: swannsong

customer_reviews.title: Had a previous version and loving the slimmer design. ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a previous version and loving the slimmer design. The stress monitor feature is way off but the Move IQ and GPS option outweigh it by a lot. Also, it’s easier to read text alerts.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but know that the 'red' strap is actually pink.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son (13) as a replacement. The family all have Garmin products and we use it to challenge and encourage each other to be active. It's mainly my son tell me to get off my rear and do something. Unfortunately, the red band is actually pink. Given that we are Garmin fans, I just swapped his strap for his mom's black strap. However, that color issue costs Garmin a star as they advertise as it being red.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this device. Easy to use and quite functional. Unfortunately the strap is not durable.
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this if you swim
customer_reviews.text: Swim support is misleading and useless. There is no activity profile for it and using Other or Cardio fails. While swimming the Vivosport keeps vibrating with alerts that it has auto-paused. That's extremely irritating and distracting, and since swimming is an important activity I want to capture, this was a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Edward Given

customer_reviews.title: Disposable fitness watch.
customer_reviews.text: The watch works fine although the screen is not very bright. The problem with this watch is that the band in integrated in the body of the piece, so once the band fails it CANNOT be replaced and the whole watch becomes unusable. It is a disposable fitness band.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life and Wristband
customer_reviews.text: Battery life was great when it was brand new (could go 3-4 days between charges). 6 months in and it needs charged daily now. Wrist band broke after 9 months near the body of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: ANONYMOUS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this particular fitness tracker because it had good reviews. Within a few months of receiving it, it started incorrectly counting the flights of stairs I took. Sometimes it would credit me extra flights, and sometimes (mostly) it wouldn't recognize most or any flights of stairs I took. Now, 14 months after wearing it, I woke up to find the watch band loop broke off during the night while sleeping. I can't wear the watch with the end of the watch band flapping loosely. I have a small wrist so it's a significant amount of band. Needless to say, I am disappointed in this product and don't feel it was worth the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Band Breaks after years use
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, but this is my second one and each watch the band broke after a years worth of use. The first watch I took off all the time when showering, pools, or any water. Took care of it well and band brok directly at clasp. Second watch I was thinking I will just leave on ALL the time, cause maybe taking it off and on wore out band. Well that didn't work either. Almost exactly a year to date it broke again. Unfortunately you can not simply change out this band, its all one piece. Never making that mistake again. Next watch band is going to be replacable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mossburg

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it mainly for my cycling, but also enjoy the other standard functions (heart rate, sleep monitoring, and others). However, I am still learnng about tracking other activities and in particular it does not reslly work with swimming. Overall I am enjoying it. Both the syncing to the phone and computer works well. The software requires a lot of "drilling down: to find what I am looking for, but basically it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: kayjay

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The band broke after 5 months. This is not a durable product. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M Arce

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I usually love Garmin products, this one not so much. Heartrate is not accurate at all, doesn't accurately count flights of stairs and doesn't keep track of all intense exercise. Not a fan and would return it if it was still within the 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Bewar if you buy from Newwavedigital
customer_reviews.text: slow ship and not only requires signature( fine with that) BUT ADULT SIGNATURE so you HAVE to go to the po to get it unless you are lucky enuf to be home on the first and only try I love this watch, it does all and is accurate
customer_reviews.author: Kansas

customer_reviews.title: No replacement for its band!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as replacement of fitbit blaze that was not charging anymore. The battery life is vert good and looks like is more accurate than the previous monitor. The problem is the plastic band has no replacement. After 4 months of use the band broke. I am using it at the first available position of the band. I think that for its cost, it should last a lot more than it has. I thought I could buy a replacement band but has learned that is not available for this model. I recommend anyone considering this model to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: jburset

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great and once you play around with it for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great and once you play around with it for a little bit, you get used to all of the functions. It has everything that you could want in a compact, small band. I have had it for a few days now and the only issue that I have is that when I have been going out for a run, when I go to set it, it keeps telling me to wait for GPS and never connects. I have no been able to track outdoor workouts on it yet which is very frustrating. If anyone has any advice on how to ix this please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Ports 1961 NY Office

customer_reviews.title: A Mistake
customer_reviews.text: A terrible step back from the HR+. Tiny screen. No physical button. Twitchy response of the touchscreen caused it to switch to Italian where it is now stuck on some message that I cant move on from. Screen is stuck. Never actually got to use this piece of crap so I cant comment on the gps or features. I am going to let the battery die and see if it unlocks. In the meantime Tieni premuto la scherma, whatever that means.
customer_reviews.author: marktwain

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy vivisport
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for 13 months and it has been a headache to sync. Just bought a new phone and tried multiple times to sync. Finally recognized and did a sync with iPhone app unfortunately it was inaccurate. Tried to return to Amazon but but it is outside 12 month warranty. Look at other fitness monitors and save yourself the brain damage that comes with Garmin. BTW should have learned from previous Garmin products how persnickety they can be.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: She is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas. She is very happy with it. The gps works great and she loves having the stepping and stair climbing goals every day. We both like that it's a capable watch, but does not look like a bulky smart watch. It's a nice simple design, and everything seems big enough to read. The GPS takes a little while to connect the first time, but it is much quicker the following times.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Great Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that not only tracked steps, but elevation too. This tracker also includes GPS capabilities, gives time, date, temperature and alerts you to calls, emails and other phone alerts. Though you can't talk using the vivosport, you can push answer or decline calls. I have been swimming several times and it is waterproof. The charge lasts for 5 or 6 days (3 to 4 using the GPS). It is not as easy to set up as it should be (IMHO) - but otherwise, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product less than 4 months and the band has broken. I bought a warranty through Square Trade and it has been difficult to fill out the reimbursement forms. Not a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: B Bennett

customer_reviews.title: way better than any fit bit
customer_reviews.text: way better than any fit bit, battery lasts 5-7 days depending on things like using it to track your workouts etc. love the alarms, the vibration works well, the night setting is great. the only complaint is the band that holds the excess watch band, it doesnt firmly stick and sometimes moves a lot
customer_reviews.author: lizardmom

customer_reviews.title: Great for GPS....
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great for GPS, which is why most people get it. If you are looking for a good heart monitor and step counter, you should definitely look elsewhere. No matter why your arm moves, it counts as a step. Also the heart monitor is never even close to accurate. Compared to a manual pulse, it is always at least 30 bpm off. This is unacceptable, especially since it is one of the main features. Definitely good for GPS, but that is about it.
customer_reviews.author: slish

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a few months and very happy with it. The app works well and now they've ironed out live track (although you do need to take your phone for livetrack to work) it's great for family to track me and know when I'll be home. Only downfall is i don't find it picks up gps from within the house, but I just put it into gps mode while I put my my shoes on outside and that seems to work. I've never used it in water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Band broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: Great little tracker. Love that it's waterproof and emails my husband when I go for a run. I don't love that the band broke without warning after a year. Garmin is standing behind the device and replacing it with minimal hassle (must be a fairly common complaint), but I'll be without a tracker for about three weeks, which doesn't make me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I love these devices, I just bought my 2nd to replace a 2yo one that I beat up pretty badly and it finally gave out (no fault of the device, truly) I wear mine 24x7, workout daily and love the Garmin connect app. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PcW

customer_reviews.title: Little smart watch that could.
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch, was looking for an intro smart watch and this did not disappoint. Fantastic battery life, GPS, sold. I could see how the display could be small, don't get this if you're looking to look at your phone less.... But as a workout buddy it's fantastic. I was also concerned about my heart rate, now I'm not! Great piece of mind, and the garmin connect app is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Motrin

customer_reviews.title: No customer support ... not enough bug fixes
customer_reviews.text: My VO2 max stopped working, and by reading dozens of posts on the Garmin Forum (on Garmin's own site), this is obviously a widespread issue, and has been for some time. Garmin hasn't even responded to inquiries, does not answer the phone... It's too bad, I chose Garmin after going through 3 fitbits (who didn't stand behind their product either) hoping for something more dependable. Also the lack of options for indoor (spin) cycle training.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: The heart monitor in this tracker is worthless. That is the main reason I bought it. I don't know if other trackers are any better, but this one is wildly off track. At times it shows my pulse rate at 116 or so when it is actually as low as 65. I bought one for my wife as well. Same bad results. Too bad we waited past the thirty day return date or I would have sent them both back. As it is, we're out $248 and you can't get jack for them on LetGo or OfferUp, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Garmin is better than fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for what I need to track my daily steps, sleep, heart rate, etc. Much more accurate than a fit bit in my opinion as well as the durability of it as I am an active person. Love the app as you can set up with your family, I purchase one for my wife and my 8 year so which can create a weekly competition in weekly steps and keeps my son super engaged with it. Would recommend and I would buy if again.
customer_reviews.author: alexander roig

customer_reviews.title: Broken Strap after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't purchase this product again. I found the product to have great features and be easy to use. The problem is that the watch is now unusable because of a broken strap broke after ~6 months of use ... and from what I can tell, there isn't a way to replace it. I love throwing my money down the toilet. Thanks Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Not pleased. Does not do all the things mentioned. This is disappointing as my son spent birthday money on This. Shame that it was advertised as such a good but.
customer_reviews.author: adutt

customer_reviews.title: It can get in the way.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this to Amazon/Garmin. It is not as intuitive as it should be. Multiple steps too often. Also, and primarily, I found it to get in the way with sleeves, gloves, etc. Although I liked the sleep info available when wearing it overnight, it was heavy and annoying. I have skinny wrists so even though I bought the sm/med, I had to keep it on tightly or it warned me that it was loose.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bergen

customer_reviews.title: Impressive fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I'm trust impressed with this activity tracker. The only down side is that in order to get the band replaced, you have to send it in. You get one replacement free if the band breaks. It should be designed so you can replace the band your self too keep using it. It's compatible with Myfitnnesspal. I enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: What time is it? Where are my notifications? Why is it not syncing?
customer_reviews.text: This is a headache! It doesn’t sync. It doesn’t keep the correct time. The only thing it is good for it keeping track of steps. The notifications work half the time. I have it set for do not disturb so I do not get alerts in the middle of the night, I get alerts and it wakes me up. I am not impressed. My husband has one too and same thing. We are disgusted with then performance of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: non-replaceable band
customer_reviews.text: The watch is good but it's on a cheap plastic band that does not last. The band is broken on mine and Garmin quoted $89 to replace it. Hey, Garmin, how about designing your stuff so that the band can be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I had the Vivosport 3 watch and I am glad I sold it and got this
customer_reviews.text: I had the Vivosport 3 watch and I am glad I sold it and got this, wanted something smaller and hooked up tp my IPhone and my Fitness pal, perfect tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Garcia Jr

customer_reviews.title: Garmin...Some of us need a larger band
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by the functionality EXCEPT the device does not fit my wrist. I have an older Vivofit purchased with a x-large band. Since the band is not replaceable and a x-large is not available I had to return. Purchased a Fitbit Charge 3 with their standard large band. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: band of the watch is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The watch is good, since I like garmin watches. However it is not really good for swimming as the previous version was. They changed the push button to a touch button on this new version and this push button does not like water. Besides that the band is very poor. AFter less than 6 month wearing it, it broke. I have tried to write Garmin support 2 times to get them to react, because I do not have time to call them all the time. But not a single reply yet. So this time both a poor product and poor support.
customer_reviews.author: Tazman

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and seems accurate. Very lightweight and easy to view (even with my poor eyesight at 71 yrs old).
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised and like that it looks more like a bracelet vs a ...
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised and like that it looks more like a bracelet vs a watch. gives me the leeway to use my other watches along with it.
customer_reviews.author: EiZ

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen is a little wonky
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about it is the sensitivity of the touchscreen. Sometimes simply crossing my arms will trigger the touch screen, but tapping it with my finger won't. I really like everything else about it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great! I am still learning some things on it, but as far as tracking steps & sleep, it's been amazing for me. You can go back to any previous date to check data & it seems pretty accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Keisha Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: HR monitor barely works - bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Unless you're on a cardio machine, don't expect to get any sort of accurate HR reading from this device. I like the gps feature that tracks my hikes, but otherwise would not buy this device again. customer service kept giving me push back when I contacted them about the issue, and based on that, I won't be buying garmin again. they claimed no issues with the HR monitor...reviews and message boards say otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Black

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. The price is right, and it gives me all of the data I want to track my progress. Solid buy. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Super durable. Takes 30 mins to charge for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Super durable. Takes 30 mins to charge for a full weeks use.
customer_reviews.author: kdeputy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little product
customer_reviews.text: My Xmas present to my wife. She absolutely loves it, following a fair experience with FitBit. No complaints so far!
customer_reviews.author: Spiros

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Since I have some Afib I was most interested in the heart rate monitoring function of the watch. It was off by 30-50 bpm (depending on which time I measured) when matched against my personal count and the heart monitor on a stationary bike. I liked the watch's style and other functions but it failed on my primary reason for purchase. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: coffe lover

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from Garmin...
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking this health watch. Great fit, soft strap, and easy to use. GPS took a few minutes too find a signal first time out but seems to be ok now.
customer_reviews.author: iPad artist

customer_reviews.title: VivoSmart SM/MED wrist band is MUCH smaller that other VivoFit SM/MED bands
customer_reviews.text: I liked the display and flatter profile as a tracker to wear 24/7. I was surprised that the SM/Med band size did not fit my wrist as I have purchased multiple Garmin Vivofit/Vivo Active trackers in the SM/MED size. I was disappointed when I discovered that the band is integral with the tracker and cannot be replaced with a larger size or color. Silicone bands usually last me one year before wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis S Kimball Jr

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Vivosport.
customer_reviews.text: Great product but the band is not interchangeable. Only downfall. They did replace while under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Vetre

customer_reviews.title: Simple watch does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fitness watch to record daily physical activity walking, running , record heat rate and gps. This watch does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Shun

customer_reviews.title: Great until it wasn’t ...
customer_reviews.text: Liked the functionality a lot, but when I whacked it against something, the crystal cracked, so it’s no longer waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: BeveB

customer_reviews.title: Best for bicycle riders
customer_reviews.text: Totally love it. I bought it because if gos tracking while bicycle riding. It calculate the accurate distance , time .
customer_reviews.author: Saj S

customer_reviews.title: Blutooth problem
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connection - especially during app starting - is not stable, sometimes app doesn’t recognize it is connected even the phone shows through phone settings it is connected
customer_reviews.author: AKIN OKVUR

customer_reviews.title: This is a gem among all wearable and works great. you can track all activities day and night ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a gem among all wearable and works great. you can track all activities day and night as battery life is great. GPS works perfect and touch screen it the one I most like.
customer_reviews.author: Kwan H Lee

customer_reviews.title: Trash HR monitor throws off everything else
customer_reviews.text: That's pretty much it. At extreme activity levels, it cuts the heart rate in half. Which throws off the calorie counter, the activity tracker, the... Step count is good, stairs tracker is good, everything else depends on an accurate heart rate that this cannot give.
customer_reviews.author: K Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Wears it every day, great product with all the bells & whistles. Only problem is the strap broke already.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBum2U

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device for sport activity however I think it will ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device for sport activity however I think it will be more suitable for running, I am using it for crossfit and strength training and the screen is hard to use when you are sweating
customer_reviews.author: KSH

customer_reviews.title: Quite a satisfying product.
customer_reviews.text: Its been a very satisfying purchase, it reached on time. I like the way it fits, its light on your wrist comfortable. In fact if usually forget to take it off when I go to sleep. Super duper :)
customer_reviews.author: ASharma

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke 31 days into a 30 day return window
customer_reviews.text: The strap broke after 4 weeks. took a day too long to check into returning it. Bought May 11, today is June 12. I understand others have had this same issue. Buyer Beware! Replacements are NOT available. Every other Garmin Vivo Something has a replacement but not this model......Happy Mothers Day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate tracking is inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure that the this tracked my heart rate accurately. It would be low during my run and high afterwards. After trying this watch, I will prefer having a button to start and stop my activities than swiping.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Sleep activity doesn’t tell you much anyway
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the like coming on in the middle of the night when I’m trying to sleep. I am not trying to see the time. So I stopped wearing it at night
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gerst

customer_reviews.title: Check your wrist size
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up, my wrist is not that big, so I thought a small/medium would fit. It didn't so I had to send it back. The s/m is really quite small.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal heart rate measurements
customer_reviews.text: The central feature of the fitness tracker is to measure heart rate. This device is awful at measuring heart rate when there is any amount of wrist movement involved. The error in measurements can be as big as a 100 (one hundred, no typos!) BPM. I strongly recommend not buying any device of this kind until technology matures.
customer_reviews.author: elsuztanh

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time I bought this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd GARMIN product that I have bought. It is reliable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Tracks walks, runs, and bike rides!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. GPS is very accurate in measuring distance.
customer_reviews.author: John N. Martindale

customer_reviews.title: Lousy product, terrible support
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of you-know-what. The battery lost almost all its capacity less than two months after I bought it. Garmin offered a replacement - if I send mine in first, at my own expense, and wait several weeks for them to send me a new one. First and last Garmin device.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Owen

customer_reviews.title: VIVOSPORT
customer_reviews.text: LIKE THE PRODUCT AS THERE ARE MANY OPTIONS, BUT NOT AS CUSTOMIZABLE IF PLAY A SPORT LIKE TENNIS, OR PILATES. ALSO, THE SCREEN IS RATHER SMALL AND SO WHEN SEEKING DATA CAN BE FRUSTRATING IF YOU HAVE MED TO BIG FINGERS
customer_reviews.author: TS of Scottsadale

customer_reviews.title: Love the latest version
customer_reviews.text: Love the new design- stronger wrist band and color graphics
customer_reviews.author: RPS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love the Vivosport so much. It offers basic fitness tracking plus a GPS and a few Firstbeat metrics. The GPS accuracy could be better but it's not an issue really. It's better than every other fitness band out there because of the integrated GPS.
customer_reviews.author: DrBeekJeek

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for this
customer_reviews.text: I only wear this while working out. It is perfect for this!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade from previous Garmins. Really disappointed! GPS takes too long to set on runs. Glass breaks too easily with normal wear which I found out quickly is not covered on warranty. Band tore after a few months of use. My other Garmins lasted years with same wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Nelson

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for a heart rate training, keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a training tool. This isn’t it. The wrist- based heart rate monitor just isn’t as accurate as a chest band. The screen isn’t big enough for useful feedback during a workout. It’s a fine 24/7 activity tracker, but it’s not good for performance training.
customer_reviews.author: C. Loeb

customer_reviews.title: Band breaks easy, Not recommended for swimmers or surfers
customer_reviews.text: The screen has no remote lock mode so when swimming the water touch the screen and and lock/unlock and do unwanted actions like start/pausing activities. Don't recommend in the water. The band got broken just after warranty time and is not possible to replace, just garmin support can do it and is super expensive, even worst if you need international support.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Band will break very easily on this one
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good activity tracker, but my band broke at the junction of the electronics and the band, which, as another reviewer pointed out, is very thin and therefore prone to break.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Runners
customer_reviews.text: I am using Vivosport for almost 1 year. I don't go gym, I am a regular outdoor runner. Vivosport is perfect for running with GPS. With its small and thin design I use it everyday also at office, and I track my daily movements and sleep quality. More than enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rifat öcal

customer_reviews.title: The android app that supports the device is excellent, very clear
customer_reviews.text: Have bought two of these now, one for me and one for my dad. I did a fair bit of research before purchasing the first (for me) and I am hugely impressed. The android app that supports the device is excellent, very clear, highly customisable and user friendly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Garmin Vivosport
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this watch is terrible! The face of the watch cracked a month ago (I've only worn for 3 months). The functions on the watch are not intuitive at all either. I would not recommend this at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffe

customer_reviews.title: Love the tracker....but wristband broke
customer_reviews.text: Great tracker, loved it...until the wristband broke, now it’s useless! Back to wearing my 3 year old vivofit!
customer_reviews.author: Annette  M

product_meta.title: Garmin vívosport, Fitness/Activity Tracker with GPS and Heart Rate Monitoring, Slate
product_meta.description: Size:S/M| Color:SlateThere?s a lot of get-up-and-move packed into this activity tracker. Though it?s compact enough to suit any occasion, v?vosport features built-in GPS, which lets you accurately track your activities outside while also including a variety of indoor activities. It brings you fitness monitoring tools and all-day stress tracking plus handy connected features, including automatic uploads to our Garmin Connect online fitness community. It?s the complete activity tracking package. Strap material - Silicone
feature_bullets: Work out inside, or use built-in GPS to accurately track activities outside
Includes fitness monitoring tools such as Vo2 Max and fitness made estimates. Smartphone compatibility- iPhone, android, windows
All-day stress tracking helps you stay in touch with your body’s response to potential stressors
Features always-on color Garmin chroma display and slim profile. Display size: 0. 38 x 0. 76 inches
Get connected features such as smart notifications, Live Track and more. Small/medium fits wrists with a circumference of 4. 8-7. 4 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars724 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
